meanings.sent1: She overcools the soup every time she forgets about it on the stove.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream overcools if you leave it in the freezer for too long.
meanings.sent3: The overcooled drink turned into a slushie by mistake.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm overcools when he realizes the task is more challenging than expected.
meanings.sent5: The overcooled metal felt icy to the touch.

meanings.sent1: The swimming pool overcools quickly in the chilly weather.
meanings.sent2: The tea overcools if you leave it on the table for too long.
meanings.sent3: The overcooled room made everyone shiver uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Her heart overcools when she hears the tragic news.
meanings.sent5: The overcooled air outside made her breath visible in the winter morning.
